text.content:
SAFETY PLAN: 
                             ============
  Step 1 - Warning signs:
    Feeling hopeless about the present or future
    Lack of interest in my children's activities
    Lack of contact with Friends
 
   ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 
  Step 2 - Internal coping stategies (Things I can do to take my mind off
  my problems without contacting another person):
    Call a friend
    Listen to music
    Read a book
    Call my Kids
 
   ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 
  Step 3 - People and social settings that provide distraction:
    Name: Jane Doe Phone: 987-654-3210
    Name: John Doe Phone: 123-456-7890
    Place: Library
 
   ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 
  Step 4 - People whom I can ask for help:
    Name: Jane Doe   Phone: 555-555-1234 
 
    Name: John Doe   Phone: 555-555-1234 
      Alt Phone: 555-555-4321 (Cell)
    Name: Mrs. Smith   Phone: 555-555-4321 
 
 
   ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 
  Step 5 - Professionals or agencies I can contact during a crisis:
    Clinician: Dr. Pyschiatrist   Phone: 555-555-9876 x3456 
      Clinic/Emergency Contact#: 555-555-9876 x3333 
 
    Clinician: Mrs. Counselor   Phone: 555-555-9876 x6543 
      Clinic/Emergency Contact#: 555-555-9876 x0 
 
    Local Urgent Care Services: VA Medical Center 
      Phone: 555-555-9876 x 4444 
      Address: 1234 Anystreet, Anytown, 
    Suicide Prevention Coordinator: Nurse Ratchet, RN 
                             Phone: 555-555-9876 x3093
    Suicide Prevention Coordinator: Social R. Worker, LCSW 
                             Phone: 555-555-9876 x11171
    Va Suicide Prevention Hotline Phone: 1-800-273-TALK (8255), push 1 to
    reach a VA mental health clinician.
 
   ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 
  Step 6 - Making the environment safe:
    Removing access to firearms:
    All of her guns and ammo were given to a neighbor for safe keeping. 
    Neighbor has them locked in a safe.
    Removing access to other weapons:
    No other weapons in the home
 
Has a printed copy of this note been given to the Veteran?
  Yes.
text.author: NURSE,TWELVE
